questions.question: The Passage is about-
questions.explanation: The passage mainly engages about Artificial Intelligence. Thus, the passage is about Al.

questions.question: Who is the father of Al?
questions.explanation: The father of Al is John McCarthy.

questions.question: Artificial Intelligence is a-
questions.explanation: Artificial Intelligence is a branch of computer science.

questions.question: Al can think-----manner that intelligent humans the
questions.explanation: Al can think in a similar manner that intelligent humans think.

questions.question: The synonym of the word exponentially is——-
questions.explanation: The synonym of the word exponentially is rapidly. Logarithmic growth, slowly, sluggishly - all of these mean the opposite of exponentially.

questions.question: What is the synonym of Sagacious?
questions.explanation: Sagacious means wise or judicious. Malice means the intention to do evil, malicious is used to describe a person who holds malice, critical means expressing disapproving comments.

questions.question: The Synonym of Assiduity is-
questions.explanation: Assiduity to put very constant attention into something, which aligns with steadfastness. Omnipresence means being present at all times, anxiety is an emotion of inner turmoil, and reluctance means the disapproval to do something.

questions.question: What is the antonym of Copious?
questions.explanation: Copious means abundant amount of something. So, the antonym here is insufficient.

questions.question: The antonym of Coarse is-
questions.explanation: Coarse means a rough texture. The antonym here is bland.

questions.question: What is the synonym of Tangible?
questions.explanation: Tangible means something that is perceptible by touch. Thus, concrete is the most suitable synonym here. Abstract and impalpable, both of which denote something that unable to be perceived by touch, are direct antonyms.

questions.question: The antonym of Dismoy is -
questions.explanation: Dismay means distress; thus, the antonym is joy.

questions.question: Credulous: Sceptical
questions.explanation: Credulous and skeptical mean the opposite. Credulous means a person who shows readiness to believe everything. Skeptical means a person who is not at all easily convinced. Among all the options, only placate and irritate mean the opposite. Placate means to lessen anger, and irritate means to make someone annoyed or angry

questions.question: Author: Copyright
questions.explanation: An author uses copyright to protect their work from plagiarism. An inventor uses patent to protect their work.

questions.question: Discharged: Soldier
questions.explanation: A soldier is discharged when their duty is over. A student graduates when they are done with their education.

questions.question: We do not learn-----mistakes
questions.explanation: From is the correct form of preposition here.

questions.question: The lady prides herself——-her beauty
questions.explanation: Upon is the correct form of preposition here.

questions.question: Identify the correct sentence
questions.explanation: Glasses

questions.question: Which one of the following is correct?

options.label: ক
options.text: The poor is born to suffer.

options.label: খ
options.text: The poor are born to suffer.

questions.option_a: The poor is born to suffer.
questions.option_b: The poor are born to suffer.
questions.explanation: The poor here denotes multiple poor people, which demands an article before the word poor and a plural verb.

questions.question: Which sentence is correct?

options.label: খ
options.text: Can you give me an advice?

questions.option_b: Can you give me an advice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ঘ – None Explanation: "Luggage" is uncountable, so we do not say "luggages." "Advice" is uncountable, so we do not say "an advice." "Scenery" is uncountable, so we do not say "sceneries" in this context.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence?

options.label: ঘ
options.text: I have paid my scholing fees.

questions.option_d: I have paid my scholing fees.

questions.question: What is the incorrect spelling?
questions.explanation: Bourgeoise is the correct spelling.

questions.question: Choose the correct spelt word?
questions.explanation: Enthusiastic is the correct spelling.

questions.question: Which one of the following is incorrect?
questions.explanation: The only incorrect option is troubadoor. The correct spelling is troubadour.

questions.question: Choose the wrongly spelt word?
questions.explanation: The wrongly spelt word is remiricence. The correct spelling is reminiscence.

questions.question: He gave up - tennis.
questions.explanation: Using infinitive (to play) and the preposition of before playing here is not suitable. Option D, play is incorrect because the base form of verb is not suitable here. The correct option is playing tennis.

questions.question: Let us play ____chess.
questions.explanation: play chess" is a compound verb, which requires no article.

questions.question: Change the voice of 'we ought to have save our environment?

options.label: ক
options.text: Our environment ought to have been saved

options.label: খ
options.text: Our environmen ought to have been save.

options.label: ঘ
options.text: Our environment ought to have saved.

questions.option_b: Our environmen ought to have been save.
questions.option_c: Our environment ought to had been saved
questions.option_d: Our environment ought to have saved.
questions.explanation: Have becomes have been in passive voice. So, the correct option is B.

questions.question: He said to me, 'Do you know me?' The correct indirect form of this sentence is :

options.label: ক
options.text: He asked me it I know him

options.label: খ
options.text: He said do I know him

options.label: গ
options.text: He asked me if I knew him

options.label: ঘ
options.text: He asked if I did know him

questions.option_a: He asked me it I know him
questions.option_b: He said do I know him
questions.option_c: He asked me if I knew him
questions.option_d: He asked if I did know him
questions.explanation: In indirect narration, to introduce a question, we use if before the question. Quotes written in simple present tense turns into simple past tense. Thus, the correct indirect form is C.

questions.question: Wordsworth is a poet of nature,_____ ?
questions.explanation: Wordsworth is male poet, and the auxiliary verb used here is demands the option B as answer.

questions.question: He has (A) received (B) my letter day before (C) yesterday (D)
questions.explanation: The action of receiving letter is already over, which means the sentence demands simple tense instead of present perfect tense.

questions.question: They ____ my proposal.
questions.explanation: Turned down is a phrase that means declining a proposal.

options.label: ক

questions.question: 'One who breaks images' is called_____
questions.explanation: Iconoclast means a person who challenges or breaks traditions and norms. Importer is a person who brings goods or services into a country from abroad for sale. Cannibal is a person who eats the flesh of other human beings. Aviary is a cage to keep birds in.

questions.question: What is the verb-form of poverty?
questions.explanation: Povert and povertive are not correct words. Poverty stricken is an adjective. Impoverish is the verb form of poverty.

questions.question: The word tolerant is____
questions.explanation: Tolerant is used to describe a person, so it is an adjective

questions.question: If a person deposit money into two banks at 6 Tk interest respectively, the difference in profit after three and half years and five years 144. How much money did the person deposit?
questions.explanation: Let the amount deposited be x x x . Interest for the first deposit = x ∗ 6 / 100 ∗ 3.5 = 0..21 x =x * 6 / 100 * 3.5=0 . .21 x = x ∗ 6/100 ∗ 3.5 = 0..21 x Interest for the second deposit = x ∗ 6 / 100 ∗ 5 = 0.3 x =x * 6 / 100 * 5=0.3 x = x ∗ 6/100 ∗ 5 = 0.3 x Difference in interest = 0.3 x − 0.21 x = 0.09 x =0.3 x-0.21 x=0.09 x = 0.3 x − 0.21 x = 0.09 x Given, 0.09 x = 0.09 x= 0.09 x = 144 x = 1600 144 x=1600 144 x = 1600 Therefore, each amount deposited is Rs. 1600

questions.question: If the ratio of red, white, and black in a solution is 3:5:7, then what is the present of white is hi that solution?
questions.explanation: To find the percentage of white in the solution, you need to know the total number of parts in the mixture and then determine the percentage of white relative to that total. In this case, the ratio of red, white, and black is 3 : 5 : 7 3: 5: 7 3 : 5 : 7 . This means that for every 3 parts of red, there are 5 parts of white and 7 parts of black. So, the total number of parts in the solution is 3 + 5 + 7 = 15 3+5+7=15 3 + 5 + 7 = 15 parts. To find the percentage of white, you can calculate (5/15) * 100 % 100 \% 100% : ( 5 / 15 ) ∗ 100 % = 33.33 % (5 / 15) * 100 \%=33.33 \% ( 5/15 ) ∗ 100% = 33.33% So, the percentage of white in the solution is approximately 33.33 % 33.33 \% 33.33% .

questions.question: If a page length and width is 2 meter and 2 meter. If you cut in length 10 centimeter and width 2 centimeter. Then how many pices you get?
questions.explanation: To calculate the possible number of squares, use the simple logic of total area/required area. In this case, total area = 2 =2 = 2 meters * 2 meters ( 200   c m ∗ 200   c m ) = 40000   c m (200 \mathrm{~cm} * 200 \mathrm{~cm})=40000 \mathrm{~cm} ( 200   cm ∗ 200   cm ) = 40000   cm Required area of the rectangle = 2   c m ∗ 10   c m = 20   c m =2 \mathrm{~cm} * 10 \mathrm{~cm}=20 \mathrm{~cm} = 2   cm ∗ 10   cm = 20   cm Possible number of squares = 40000 / 20 = 2000 =40000 / 20=2000 = 40000/20 = 2000 An easy way to look at it is how many squares of a specific dimension will "fit" given the dimensions.

This 15 cancels with 5 in the denominator and leaves { 3 } 2 ∧ − ( 17 ) \{3\} 2^{\wedge}-(17) { 3 } 2 ∧ − ( 17 ) .

questions.explanation: the first step is to get the variables up to the numerator. To do this we should find the common factor on the left side: 1 / x − 1 / ( x + 1 ) = > 1 / x-1 /(x+1)=> 1/ x − 1/ ( x + 1 ) => becomes ( x + 1 ) / ( x ) ( x + 1 ) − ( x ) / ( x ) ( x + 1 ) (x+1) /(x)(x+1)-(x) /(x)(x+1) ( x + 1 ) / ( x ) ( x + 1 ) − ( x ) / ( x ) ( x + 1 ) ⇒ > \Rightarrow> ⇒> combines to ( x + 1 ) − ( x ) / ( x ) ( x + 1 ) (x+1)-(x) /(x)(x+1) ( x + 1 ) − ( x ) / ( x ) ( x + 1 ) ⇒ > \Rightarrow> ⇒> notice that the top two Xs cancel out 1 / ( x ) ( x + 1 ) 1 /(x)(x+1) 1/ ( x ) ( x + 1 ) We now have the full equation: 1 / ( x ) ( x + 1 ) = 1 / ( x + 4 ) 1 /(x)(x+1)=1 /(x+4) 1/ ( x ) ( x + 1 ) = 1/ ( x + 4 ) We can simply swap the denominators around to have: ( x + 4 ) = x ( x + 1 ) (x+4)=x(x+1) ( x + 4 ) = x ( x + 1 ) After we expand the equation we get ( x + 4 ) = x ∧ 2 + x (x+4)=x^{\wedge} 2+x ( x + 4 ) = x ∧ 2 + x Notice that the two X X X s cancel out leaving us with: 4 = x ∧ 2 4=x^{\wedge} 2 4 = x ∧ 2 Thus we have the solution x = 2 x=2 x = 2 or -2

questions.question: If n = 3 8 − 2 8 n=3^{8}-2^{8} n = 3 8 − 2 8 , which of the following is not a factor of n n n ?
questions.explanation: we will apply the formula a ∧ 2 − b ∧ 2 a^{\wedge} 2-b^{\wedge} 2 a ∧ 2 − b ∧ 2 here and expand the equation . in the end we get (3 2 ) ( 3 + 2 ) ( 3 ∧ 2 + 2 ∧ 2 ) ( 3 ∧ 4 + 2 ∧ 4 ) = 1 × 5 × 13 × 97 2)(3+2)\left(3^{\wedge} 2+2^{\wedge} 2\right)\left(3^{\wedge} 4+2^{\wedge} 4\right)=1 \times 5 \times 13 \times 97 2 ) ( 3 + 2 ) ( 3 ∧ 2 + 2 ∧ 2 ) ( 3 ∧ 4 + 2 ∧ 4 ) = 1 × 5 × 13 × 97 , therefore the answer is (D).

questions.question: What is the smallest integer n n n for which 25 n > 5 12 25^{n}>5^{12} 2 5 n > 5 12 ?
questions.explanation: We have: 25 ∧ n > 5 ∧ 12 25^{\wedge} n>5^{\wedge} 12 2 5 ∧ n > 5 ∧ 12 To rewrite this inequality with the SAME base, we'll replace 25 with 5 2 5^{2} 5 2 . When we do so, we get: ( 5 2 ) ∧ n > 5 ∧ 12 \left(5^{2}\right)^{\wedge} n>5^{\wedge} 12 ( 5 2 ) ∧ n > 5 ∧ 12 Apply the Power of a Power law to get: 5 ∧ ( 2 n ) > 5 ∧ 12 5^{\wedge}(2 n)>5^{\wedge} 12 5 ∧ ( 2 n ) > 5 ∧ 12 This means that it must be the case that 2 n > 12 2 n>12 2 n > 12 Divide both sides of the inequality by 2 to get: n > 6 n>6 n > 6 What is the smallest integer n n n for which 25 ∧ n > 5 ∧ 12 25^{\wedge} n>5^{\wedge} 12 2 5 ∧ n > 5 ∧ 12 ? We now know that n > 6 \mathrm{n}>6 n > 6 So, 7 is the smallest possible INTEGER value that satisfies this inequality.

questions.question: If n is a positive integer and the product of all the integers from 1 to n n n , inclusive, is multiple is 990 , what is the least possible value of n n n ?
questions.explanation: This question tests the concept of prime factorization. In order to figure out if 990 can be a divisor of the unknown product you need to determine all of the prime factors that combine to successfully divide 990 without leaving a remainder. The prime factors of 990 are 2 , 3 , 3 , 5 , 11 2,3,3,5,11 2 , 3 , 3 , 5 , 11 Since 11 is a prime factor of 990, you need to have the number present somewhere in the unknown product. Answer A A A is the product of integers from 1 to 10 and therefore does not meet the necessary criteria. Answer B includes 11 and therefore is the answer.

questions.question: Last year Joe grew 1 inch and Sally grew 200 percent more than Joe grow. How many inches did Sally grow last year?
questions.explanation: We are given that last year Joe grew 1 inch and that Sally grew 200 percent more than Joe grew. This means Sally grew 300 percent as much as Joe grew. That is, Sally grew 3 times as much as Joe. Thus, Sally grew 3 × 1 = 3 3 \times 1=3 3 × 1 = 3 inches.

questions.explanation: We are given that 25 percent of n = 371 / 2 n=371 / 2 n = 371/2 percent of m m m . So we have: ( 25 / 100 ) n = ( 37.5 / 100 ) m (25 / 100) \mathrm{n}=(37.5 / 100) \mathrm{m} ( 25/100 ) n = ( 37.5/100 ) m We can multiply both sides by 100 : 25 n = 37.5 m 25 n=37.5 m 25 n = 37.5 m We can multiply both sides by 10 : 250 n = 375 m 250 n=375 m 250 n = 375 m We can divide both sides by 25 : 10 n = 15 m 2 n = 3 m \begin{array}{l} 10 n=15 m \\ 2 n=3 m \end{array} 10 n = 15 m 2 n = 3 m ​ We can multiply both sides by 6 to get the 12 n 12 n 12 n in the numerator of ( 12 n ) / m (12 n) / m ( 12 n ) / m : 12 n = 18 m 12 n=18 m 12 n = 18 m Finally, divide both sides by m m m , obtaining the value of ( 12 n ) / m (12 n) / \mathrm{m} ( 12 n ) / m : ( 12 n ) / m = 18 (12 n) / m=18 ( 12 n ) / m = 18

questions.question: Number 29 is 10 % 10 \% 10% of what number?
The price of a cycle is reduced by 25 % 25 \% 25% . The new price is reduced by a further 20 % 20 \% 20% . The two reductions together are equal to a single reduction of-
questions.explanation: Let price be Rs 100 then 1st reduction will give discounted price as Rs 75 again 2 nd reduction will yield 75 ( 1 − 20 / 100 ) 75(1-20 / 100) 75 ( 1 − 20/100 ) = = = Rs 60 (final price) so reduction from initial Rs 100 to final Rs 60 = 40 60=40 60 = 40

questions.question: Musa wants to buy a dress priced at Tk 89.75. If the sales tax is 8 % 8 \% 8% . What is the total amount he must pay for the dress?
If price of a pen increased from 25 to 37.5 . What percent of price is increased?
questions.explanation: To calculate the percentage increase, you can use the formula: % \% % Increase = [(New Value - Old Value) / Old Value] × 100 % \times 100 \% × 100% Plugging in the values given: % \% % Increase = [ ( 37.5 − 25 ) / 25 ] × 100 % % =[(37.5-25) / 25] \times 100 \% \% = [( 37.5 − 25 ) /25 ] × 100%% Increase = ( 12.5 / 25 ) × 100 % % =(12.5 / 25) \times 100 \% \% = ( 12.5/25 ) × 100%% Increase = 0.5 × 100 % % =0.5 \times 100 \% \% = 0.5 × 100%% Increase = 50 % =50 \% = 50% Therefore, the price of the pen has increased by 50 % 50 \% 50% .

questions.question: What is the cost price of a shirt which is sold at a loss of 20 % 20 \% 20% for Tk. 320 ?

Gain = = = selling price of 20 bananas = 20 × =20 \times = 20 × Rs. Cost price of 100 bananas = = = selling price - gain ⇒ 100 x − 20 x = 80 x \Rightarrow 100 x-20 x=80 x ⇒ 100 x − 20 x = 80 x Gain percentage = ( =( = ( gain × 100 ) / \times 100) / × 100 ) / cost price ⇒ ( 20 x × 100 ) / 80 x \Rightarrow(20 x \times 100) / 80 x ⇒ ( 20 x × 100 ) /80 x Gain percentage = 25 % =25 \% = 25%

questions.question: If 10 products are brought in 8 taka and 8 product are sold in 10 taka. What is the percentage of profit?
questions.explanation: Cost price of 10 products = 8 =8 = 8 taka Cost price of 1 product = 8 / 10 = 0.8 =8 / 10=0.8 = 8/10 = 0.8 taka Selling price of 8 products = 10 =10 = 10 taka Selling price of 1 product = 10 / 8 = 1.25 =10 / 8=1.25 = 10/8 = 1.25 taka Profit per product = = = Selling price - Cost price = 1.25 − 0.8 = 0.45 =1.25-0.8=0.45 = 1.25 − 0.8 = 0.45 taka Profit percentage = ( =( = ( Profit per product / / / Cost price ) × 100 = ( 0.45 / 0.8 ) × 100 = 56.25 % ) \times 100=(0.45 / 0.8) \times 100=56.25 \% ) × 100 = ( 0.45/0.8 ) × 100 = 56.25% Therefore, the profit percentage is 56.25 % 56.25 \% 56.25%

questions.question: A person bought an article for Tk 800. After 6 months he sold it for Tk 880 . Find his annual gain percent?
questions.explanation: C P = 800 S P = 880 \begin{array}{l} \mathrm{CP}=800 \\ \mathrm{SP}=880 \end{array} CP = 800 SP = 880 ​ Profit in 6months = 80 = 10 % =80=10 \% = 80 = 10% So, yearly gain = 2 ∗ 10 % = 20 % =2 * 10 \%=20 \% = 2 ∗ 10% = 20%

questions.question: How much interest will Tk 10,000 earn in 9 month at an annual rate of 6 % 6 \% 6% ?
The width of a rectangle is half of the length. If the perimeter is 96 cm, the width is ———.
If exterior angle of a polygon is 72 ∘ 72^{\circ} 7 2 ∘ , what is the number of its sides?
questions.explanation: Calculate the number of sides in the regular polygon. We do this by dividing 360 ∘ 360^{\circ} 36 0 ∘ by the size of one exterior angle, which is 72 ∘ 72^{\circ} 7 2 ∘ . The answer is 360 ∘ ÷ 72 ∘ = 5 360^{\circ} \div 72^{\circ}=5 36 0 ∘ ÷ 7 2 ∘ = 5 sides.

questions.question: The edges of a cube are all increased by 10 % 10 \% 10% . What is the percentage increase in volume?
questions.explanation: Let the edge of a cube is a Volume of cube = a 3 =a^{3} = a 3 New edge = 110 % =110 \% = 110% of a = 1.1 a \mathrm{a}=1.1 \mathrm{a} a = 1.1 a New volume = ( 1.1 a ) 3 = 1.331 a =(1.1 \mathrm{a})^{3}=1.331 \mathrm{a} = ( 1.1 a ) 3 = 1.331 a % \% % increase in volume = ( 1.331 a 3 − a 3 ) / a 3 × 100 =\left(1.331 \mathrm{a}^{3}-\mathrm{a}^{3}\right) / \mathrm{a}^{3} \times 100 = ( 1.331 a 3 − a 3 ) / a 3 × 100 = 0.331 a 3 / a 3 × 100 =0.331 \mathrm{a}^{3} / \mathrm{a}^{3} \times 100 = 0.331 a 3 / a 3 × 100 = 33.1 % =33.1 \% = 33.1% ∴ % \therefore \% ∴ % increase in volume is 33.1 % 33.1 \% 33.1% .

questions.question: Who is the oldest in the line? If A A A is older than B ; A B ; A B ; A is younger than C ; E C ; E C ; E is older than F ; C F ; C F ; C is older than E E E .
questions.explanation: According to the question, We get, C > E > F > A > B C>E>F>A>B C > E > F > A > B The oldest of all will be C C C .

questions.question: At 5 : 15 p m 5: 15 \mathrm{pm} 5 : 15 pm what angle do the hands of a clock form?
questions.explanation: Given the time 5 : 15 5: 15 5 : 15 Angle traced by hour hand in 12 hours = 360 ∘ =360^{\circ} = 36 0 ∘ Therefore, angle traced by hour hand in 515 / 60 h r s = 157.5 ∘ 515 / 60 \mathrm{hrs}=157.5^{\circ} 515/60 hrs = 157. 5 ∘ Angle traced by hour hand in 60   m i n = 360 ∘ 60 \mathrm{~min}=360^{\circ} 60   min = 36 0 ∘ Therefore, angle traced by hour hand in 15   m i n = ( 360 / 60 × 15 ) ∘ = 90 ∘ 15 \mathrm{~min}=(360 / 60 \times 15)^{\circ}=90^{\circ} 15   min = ( 360/60 × 15 ) ∘ = 9 0 ∘ Required angle = 157.5 ∘ − 90 ∘ = 67.5 ∘ =157.5^{\circ}-90^{\circ}=67.5^{\circ} = 157. 5 ∘ − 9 0 ∘ = 67. 5 ∘

questions.question: Which of the following is correct to fill the series 2 , 4 , 12 , 48 , 240 … … 2,4,12,48,240 \ldots \ldots 2 , 4 , 12 , 48 , 240 …… . ?
questions.explanation: Go on multiplying the given numbers by 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 6 2,3,4,5,6 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 , 6 . So, the correct next number is 1440 .

questions.question: A man travels 22 miles in a motorcycle. If the diametor of the wheel is 2 ft then how many times has the wheel has rotated?
questions.explanation: circumference = π × =\pi \times = π × diameter In this case, the diameter of the wheel is 2 feet, so the circumference of the wheel is: circumference = π × 2 = 6.28 =\pi \times 2=6.28 = π × 2 = 6.28 feet To find out how many times the wheel has rotated, we need to divide the distance traveled by the circumference of the wheel: number of rotations = distance traveled / circumference of the wheel Since the distance traveled is given as 22 miles, we need to convert it to feet: 22 miles = 22 × 5280 =22 \times 5280 = 22 × 5280 feet ( 1 (1 ( 1 mile = 5280 =5280 = 5280 feet ) = 116 , 160 )=116,160 ) = 116 , 160 feet Now we can substitute the values in the formula: number of rotations = 116160 / 6.28 = 18 , 487.58 =116160 / 6.28=18,487.58 = 116160/6.28 = 18 , 487.58 (rounded to two decimal places) Therefore, the wheel has rotated approximately 18 , 487.58 18,487.58 18 , 487.58 times.

questions.question: Area of a circle is 16 sq meter, perimeter is 8 meter. What is its radlus?
questions.explanation: Using the formula C = 2 π r C=2 \pi r C = 2 π r Solving for r = C 2 π = 8 π = 4 \begin{array}{l} r=C \\ 2 \pi=8 \\ \pi=4 \end{array} r = C 2 π = 8 π = 4 ​

questions.question: In △ A B C , A B = A C \triangle A B C, A B=A C △ A BC , A B = A C and ∠ B A C = 50 ∘ \angle B A C=50^{\circ} ∠ B A C = 5 0 ∘ . What is the value of ∠ A B C \angle A B C ∠ A BC ?
